title: A novel nerol-segmented waterborne polyurethane coating for the prevention of dental erosion
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,16228-16239
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA01744G, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Peipei Huang, Qiongfang Nie, Yu Tang, Shunshun Chen, Kaiyuan He, Mingguo Cao, Zefeng Wang
Dental erosion is a common problem in dentistry, and it refers to the chronic pathological loss of dental hard tissues due to nonbacterially produced acids, primarily caused by the exposure of teeth to exogenous acids.
